chapter.title: User Management
chapter.para: A user must have the Administrator role to perform administrator functions, such as create a new user account, assign role(s), and deactivate a users account. The following sections describes these functions.

section.title: Create a New User
section.para: To add a new user, select the View Users option under the username, which in this case is "admin" in the upper right hand corner, . Once View Users is selected View Accounts page will display.
The next page will display a list of all the user accounts in Knowledge, as show in . To create a new account select the New Account button and enter the required information, refer to .

On the Create a New Account page below, fill in the following information:
Display Name – the name that will be displayed in the upper right corner of the Editor and display as the author in the Editor as well. The Knowledge Manager Homepage will display the User Name in the upper right corner.
User Name – enter the users name. The user's name is used to log in.
Email – enter the email address associated with the user account. The user can also log in using this e-mail address.
Password – entering a password is optional
Role – a user can have more than one role; select the role(s) for this user
Select Create Account to create a new user account.

section.title: Modifying a User's Role
section.para: An Administrator can modify a user's role by selecting View Users then selecting Edit next to the user's name in the list, refer to . This will bring you to the Edit Account Profile, select Edit again under Project Roles. This will direct you to for the user.

A user can have more than one role. You can modify a user's role by selecting more than one role in the Edit Account Roles, refer to . When done modifying a user's role(s), select Save to change the user's permission(s) or select Cancel to cancel the modifications made and return to the previous page.

section.title: Disabling a User Account
section.para: The Administrator can also disable a user's account by selecting View Users and then select Edit next to the user to be disabled. This will direct the administrator to the Edit Account Profile select the Disable Account checkbox. Disabling will prevent the user from using their credentials to log in to Knowledge – they will no longer have any priviledges in Knowledge. Then select Save to disable the account or select Cancel to cancel the modifications made and return to the View Accounts page.

section.title: Deleting a User
section.para: As another option, the Administrator can permanently delete a user from the system. Deleting an account will prevent the user from logging in permanently. If you want to temporarily suspend access, follow the steps for disabling a user account instead, . To delete a user, select View Users from the admin menu and review the list of user accounts. On the right side of the list, there is a corresponding link to remove the user.

para.emphasis: Note: Deleting a user will permanently remove the account from the system. There is no way to undo this.

section.title: Return to Knowledge Homepage
section.para: To return to the Knowledge homepage from View Users go to username, which in this case is "admin" in the upper right-hand corner and select Home.
